meanings.definition: To retract or take back something previously said.
meanings.sent1: She quickly unsays her hurtful words and apologizes.
meanings.sent2: He often unsays his promises when he realizes he can't keep them.
meanings.sent3: The magician unsays his spell, making the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The artist unsays his bold brush strokes, creating a blank canvas once more.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unsays the incorrect answer, guiding the student to the right one.

meanings.definition: To leave unspoken or not express verbally.
meanings.sent1: He unsays his feelings, keeping them hidden deep inside.
meanings.sent2: She unsays her thoughts, preferring to listen instead.
meanings.sent3: The shy child unsays his request, afraid of rejection.
meanings.sent4: The unsaid words between them unsays the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The unsaid truth unsays louder than any spoken words.
